questions.question_text: Which practice nurtures links with stakeholders at strategic and tactical levels?

discussion.content:
Correct answer B:
5.1.9 Relationship management: The purpose of the relationship management practice is to establish and nurture the links between the organization and its stakeholders at strategic and tactical levels.

Selected Answer: B
Relationship Management focuses on building and nurturing links with stakeholders at both strategic and tactical levels to ensure alignment between service providers and stakeholders.

Key Terms: "Links with stakeholders" and "strategic and tactical levels" directly point to managing relationships.
Other practices, like Supplier Management or Service Level Management, may involve stakeholders but are more focused on specific contracts or performance metrics, not broad relationship building.

questions.question_text: Which is a way of applying the guiding principle 'focus on value'?

discussion.content: ITIL 4 Manuscript: 4.3.1.4 Know how service consumers use each service

To apply this principle successfully, consider this advice:
• Know how service consumers use each service.
• Encourage a focus on value among all staff.
• Focus on value during normal operational activity as well as during improvement initiatives.
• Include a focus on value in every step of any improvement initiative.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT recommended by the guiding principle 'start where you are'?

choices.D: Collecting data directly from the source
choices.B: Identifying what is available to be leveraged
choices.A: Asking questions that appear to be stupid

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Start Where You Are - When engaged in any improvement initiative, do NOT start over without first considering what is already available to be leveraged.

questions.question_text: Which is a use of a continual improvement register?

choices.D: Describing the services designed to meet the needs of a consumer group
choices.B: Selecting the right method, model or technique for identifying improvements
choices.C: Tracking and managing improvement ideas from identification through to final action
choices.A: Planning changes, assisting in communication, avoiding conflicts, and assigning resources

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
5.1.2 continual improvement
To track and manage improvement ideas from identification through to final action, organizations use a database or structured document called a continual improvement register (CIR). There can be more than one CIR in an organization, as multiple CIRs can be maintained on individual, team, departmental, business unit, and organizational levels. Some organizations maintain a single master CIR, but segment how it is used and by whom at a more granular level.

questions.question_text: Which practice uses pre-defined, standardized procedures to enable fulfilment times to be clearly communicated?

discussion.content:
B. Service level management

Service level management is the practice of pre-defining, communicating, and agreeing on service level targets (SLAs) and operational level agreements (OLAs) with customers and other stakeholders. These agreements establish expectations for the availability, performance, and quality of IT services, and provide a basis for measuring and reporting on service performance. Service level management also includes the use of standardized procedures to enable fulfillment times to be clearly communicated and agreed upon with customers.
